info.title: Natif Document Capturing API
info.description:
# Getting Started

Welcome to the auto-generated [natif.ai](https://natif.ai) API documentation. We recommend going through
[developer.natif.ai](https://developer.natif.ai) documentation for getting started with our API and
step-by-step guide for authentication, sign-up, etc.

Account managers and resellers are referred to the [User Management](#tag/User-Management) section.

post.description: Use the `password` flow to obtain an access token and a refresh token. You can use the `refresh_token` flow to replace an expired access token. Pass the obtained bearer token in the Authorization header to authorize your API requests.

parameters.description: This parameter is not required anymore. You are automatically signed in to the correct realm.

schema.title: Realm
schema.description: This parameter is not required anymore. You are automatically signed in to the correct realm.

parameters.name: realm

get.description: Queries for documents that fulfill given parameters.

parameters.description: Pass the date in ISO 8601 format.

schema.title: Date From
schema.description: Pass the date in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: date_from

parameters.description: Pass the date in ISO 8601 format.

schema.title: Date To
schema.description: Pass the date in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: date_to

parameters.description: Filter by processing status. One of "success", "pending", "failed", or "all" to not filter by status.

schema.title: Status
schema.description: Filter by processing status. One of "success", "pending", "failed", or "all" to not filter by status.

parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Return each document's postprocessing status, if it is set. This parameter is deprecated: The postprocessing status is always returned, if it is set.

schema.title: Get Postprocessing Status
schema.description: Return each document's postprocessing status, if it is set. This parameter is deprecated: The postprocessing status is always returned, if it is set.

parameters.name: get_postprocessing_status

parameters.description: Filter by postprocessing status. One of "reviewed", "rejected", "toreview", "manual", "auto", "pending", "warning", or "all" to not filter by postprocessing status.

schema.title: Postprocessing Status
schema.description: Filter by postprocessing status. One of "reviewed", "rejected", "toreview", "manual", "auto", "pending", "warning", or "all" to not filter by postprocessing status.

parameters.name: postprocessing_status

parameters.description: Return detailed processing information for documents processed by a workflow.

schema.title: Get Process Instance
schema.description: Return detailed processing information for documents processed by a workflow.

parameters.name: get_process_instance

post.description: The following file types are supported: jpg, jpeg, tif, tiff, png, pdf, gif.

parameters.description: The type of the uploaded document. The type is determined automatically if it is not given.

schema.description: The type of the uploaded document. The type is determined automatically if it is not given.

parameters.name: document_type

parameters.description: This defaults to "de". If known, provide the language to achieve best results.You can use "xx" to indicate that the language is unknown.

schema.description: This defaults to "de". If known, provide the language to achieve best results.You can use "xx" to indicate that the language is unknown.

parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Generate a PDF file from the processed pages that can be downloaded after processing. Choose "ocr_text_layer" to generate a PDF with added searchable and copyable text.

schema.description: Generate a PDF file from the processed pages that can be downloaded after processing. Choose "ocr_text_layer" to generate a PDF with added searchable and copyable text.

parameters.name: generate_pdf

get.description: Retrieves information about the given document, amongst others the processing status.

parameters.description: Return detailed processing information for documents processed by a workflow.

schema.title: Get Process Instance
schema.description: Return detailed processing information for documents processed by a workflow.

parameters.name: get_process_instance

get.description: Retrieves the extractions for the given document. The results are specific for the document's type.

parameters.description: The version of the schema to return the data in. Pass `-1` to return the data in the latest schema. Note that different schema version can contain breaking changes.

schema.title: Schema Version
schema.description: The version of the schema to return the data in. Pass `-1` to return the data in the latest schema. Note that different schema version can contain breaking changes.

parameters.name: schema_version

schema.title: Response Get Extractions Documents  Document Id  Extractions Get

put.description: Updates the type-specific extractions for the document with given id.

get.description: Retrieves the document pages as a list of base64 encoded images.

parameters.description: Return scaled down versions of each page (by factor 4.0).

schema.title: Scaled
schema.description: Return scaled down versions of each page (by factor 4.0).

parameters.name: scaled

schema.title: Response Get Processed Pages Documents  Document Id  Processed Get

get.description: Retrieves the document pages in PDF format, augmented with OCR information. PDF files are only available for download if their generation was requested during processing.Please poll this route to retrieve the PDF, as it is generated after processing and processing status `success` does not imply that generation is finished yet.
Retrieves the ocr results for the document with the given id.

parameters.description: If "true", the text content of the page is returned as string. This option is only for the "natif" OCR format.

schema.title: Include Fulltext
schema.description: If "true", the text content of the page is returned as string. This option is only for the "natif" OCR format.

parameters.name: include_fulltext

parameters.description: If "true", information about transformations (rotation and cropping) that were applied to the input document are returned. This option cannot be combined with `include_fulltext`.

schema.title: Include Transformations
schema.description: If "true", information about transformations (rotation and cropping) that were applied to the input document are returned. This option cannot be combined with `include_fulltext`.

parameters.name: include_transformations

parameters.description: Choose the format of the returned OCR results.

schema.description: Choose the format of the returned OCR results.

parameters.name: ocr_format

schema.title: Response Get Ocr Documents  Document Id  Ocr Get

post.description: Use this route to report that document extraction contained errors. You can decide how fine-grained you want to report the error, where more information helps us to learn more quickly. If a document contained multiple errors, you can either report them all in one call, or call this route several times with individual errors.

get.description: View the usage statistics of your account.

parameters.description: Start date in ISO 8601 format. Default is the first day of current month.

schema.title: Date From
schema.description: Start date in ISO 8601 format. Default is the first day of current month.

parameters.name: date_from

parameters.description: End date in ISO 8601 format. Default is the current date and time.

schema.title: Date To
schema.description: End date in ISO 8601 format. Default is the current date and time.

parameters.name: date_to

parameters.description: Optionally, provide an interval to aggregate the usage statistics into.

schema.description: Optionally, provide an interval to aggregate the usage statistics into.

parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The name of the customer to return the usage for. This parameter is only for resellers. This parameter is deprecated, please use `customer_id` instead.

schema.title: Customer
schema.description: The name of the customer to return the usage for. This parameter is only for resellers. This parameter is deprecated, please use `customer_id` instead.

parameters.name: customer

parameters.description: The id of the customer to return the usage for. This parameter is only for resellers.

schema.title: Customer Id
schema.description: The id of the customer to return the usage for. This parameter is only for resellers.

parameters.name: customer_id

parameters.description: The name (email) of the user to return the usage for. This parameter is only for managers.

schema.title: Username
schema.description: The name (email) of the user to return the usage for. This parameter is only for managers.

parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The unique uuid of the customer.

get.description: Retrieves detailed workflow usages with daily frequency.

parameters.description: The customer to request usages for.

schema.title: Customer Id
schema.description: The customer to request usages for.

parameters.name: customer_id

parameters.description: The workflow identifier to request usages for.

schema.title: Workflow Id
schema.description: The workflow identifier to request usages for.

parameters.name: workflow_id

parameters.description: Start of the requested range as partial ISO-8601 datetime. Input format is {datetime_format}. Additional precision is discarded.Serves as an **inclusive** lower bound for the returned data points.

schema.title: Start
schema.description: Start of the requested range as partial ISO-8601 datetime. Input format is {datetime_format}. Additional precision is discarded.Serves as an **inclusive** lower bound for the returned data points.

parameters.name: start

parameters.description: End of the requested range as partial ISO-8601 datetime. Input format is {datetime_format}. Additional precision is discarded.Serves as an **inclusive** upper bound for the returned data points. The span from start to end must be at most a month. Defaults to start + 7 days.

schema.title: End
schema.description: End of the requested range as partial ISO-8601 datetime. Input format is {datetime_format}. Additional precision is discarded.Serves as an **inclusive** upper bound for the returned data points. The span from start to end must be at most a month. Defaults to start + 7 days.

parameters.name: end

parameters.description: If this flag is set to `true`, additional indicators (`num_documents`, `num_pages`, `average_time_per_page`) will be aggregated for each window.

schema.title: Extended
schema.description: If this flag is set to `true`, additional indicators (`num_documents`, `num_pages`, `average_time_per_page`) will be aggregated for each window.

parameters.name: extended

schema.title: Response Get Workflow Usage Route Implementation Reseller Customers  Customer Id  Usage Workflows  Workflow Id  Daily Get

get.description: List info about existing document sharing tokens for the current users team.

schema.title: Response List Team Document Sharing Tokens Share Tokens Documents Get

post.summary: Create a token for sharing a document
post.description: Used to create a url-token for publicly sharing single documents.

delete.summary: Revoke an existing document sharing token
delete.description: Revoke an existing sharing token via its identifier. Revoking user needs to be able to see the same token via GET /sharing/documents for this operation to succeed.

post.description: Use this route to report that document extraction contained errors. You can decide how fine-grained you want to report the error, where more information helps us to learn more quickly. If a document contained multiple errors, you can either report them all in one call, or call this route several times with individual errors.

get.description: This route dynamically returns OpenAPI documentation for the given workflow.

schema.title: Response Get Openapi Json Processing  Workflow Id  Openapi Get

get.summary: Get a list of all available workflows
get.description: Retrieves a list of all available workflows including metadata.

schema.title: Response Get Available Workflows Processing Workflows Get

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique id of this activity instance.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of this activity instance.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of this activity instance.

activity_id.title: Activity Id
activity_id.description: The id of the activity in the process definition, that this is an instance of.

task_definition_key.title: Task Definition Key
task_definition_key.description: If this activity instance is a task, the key of the task definition.

status.description: The status of this activity instance.

manual.title: Manual
manual.description: Whether this activity instance is/was executed by a human or by an automated service.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The processing priority of this activity instance. A higher value means a higher priority.

workflow_id.title: Workflow Id
workflow_id.description: The unique identifier for the workflow.

category.description: Describes what kind of workflow it is, determining e.g. how it can be managed.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the workflow.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short summary of the workflow.

long_description.title: Long Description
long_description.description: A more detailed description of the workflow.

image.title: Image
image.description: An image that represents or illustrates the workflow, represented as relative URL.

retrievable_results.title: Retrievable Results
retrievable_results.description: Lists all the results that this workflow extracts for submitted documents.

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID of the bounding box on the current page. The ID is unique per page and starts at one.

x1.title: X-coordinate of the top-left corner
x1.description: The **x-coordinate** of the `top-left` corner of the bounding box.

y1.title: Y-coordinate of the top-left corner
y1.description: The **y-coordinate** of the `top-left` corner of the bounding box.

x2.title: X-coordinate of the bottom-right corner
x2.description: The **x-coordinate** of the `bottom-right` corner of the bounding box.

y2.title: Y-coordinate of the bottom-right corner
y2.description: The **y-coordinate** of the `bottom-right` corner of the bounding box.

text.title: The text written inside the bounding box.
text.description: The text content within the bounds of this box.

text_entropy.title: The entropy of the text.
text_entropy.description: Low entropy suggests that you can trust the extraction more, while high entropy indicate more uncertainty.

date.title: Date
date.description: Partial ISO-8601 datetime format: e.g. "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY-MM-DD" or "YYYY-MM-DDThhZ" or "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ", with an accuracy depending on the aggregation frequency.

processed_credits.title: Processed Credits
processed_credits.description: Total credit cost for all successful workflow instances within the time window.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for the new customer.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email for the new user. This address will also serve as username. Instructions on how to complete account setup are sent to this address.

password.title: Password
password.description:
The default is to not provide a password. In this case the customer is sent an email with a link to verify the email address and set the password. If a password is provided, it is assumed that the email is verified and no further communication is sent to the customer.The password must be at least 12 characters long and must contain:
- a minimum of 1 lower case letter [a-z] and
- a minimum of 1 upper case letter [A-Z] and
- a minimum of 1 numeric character [0-9] and
- a minimum of 1 special character: ~!@#$%^&*()-_+={}[]|\;:<>,./?

customer_id.title: Customer Id
customer_id.description: The customer to whom this user will be added. This field is only for resellers. If you are not a reseller leave this field empty to add users to your own customer.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email of the user that will be deleted.

customer_id.title: Customer Id
customer_id.description: The customer to whom this user belongs. If you are not a reseller you can keep this empty.

username.title: Username
username.description: Required if the grant type is `password`.

password.title: Password
password.description: Required if the grant type is `password`.

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: Required if the grant type is `refresh_token`. The value is a valid refresh token previously returned by this endpoint.

scope.title: Scope
scope.description:
Required if the grant type is `password`. A whitespace separated list of scopes that the returned token should have access to. Scopes are a mechanism to limit access to your user's account and resources.

Available scopes: `capturing_write`, `capturing_read`, `postprocessing`, `user_management`, `client_management` (the OpenID Connect scopes `email` and `profile` will always be claimed)

CreatableRole.title: CreatableRole
CreatableRole.description:
The roles that users of this API can create.

    - Manager: Users with this role can manage user accounts, manage workflows and process documents.
    - Annotation Manager: Users with this role can manage user accounts, manage annotation projects and annotate.
    - User: A restricted API user, that can only process documents with pre-existing workflows.
    - Machine User: A restricted API User, that doesn't impersonate a human and can only process documents with
      pre-existing workflows.
    - Annotator: An API user that can only work on annotation tasks in existing annotation projects.
    - Demo: A limited verison of User for evaluation and demonstration purposes.

use_technical_interface.title: Use Technical Interface
use_technical_interface.description:
Determines which web interface will be displayed after login at https://platform.natif.ai for all users within this customer.
- `false`: the new Api-Hub interface
- `true`: the previous, more technical interface

username.title: Username
username.description: The email for the new user. If no initial password is provided, instructions on how to complete the account setup are sent to this address.

password.title: Password
password.description:
The default is to not provide a password. In this case the customer is sent an email with a link to verify the email address and set the password. If a password is provided, it is assumed that the email is verified and no further communication is sent to the customer.The password must be at least 12 characters long and must contain:
- a minimum of 1 lower case letter [a-z] and
- a minimum of 1 upper case letter [A-Z] and
- a minimum of 1 numeric character [0-9] and
- a minimum of 1 special character: ~!@#$%^&*()-_+={}[]|\;:<>,./?

original_page_nr.title: Original Page Nr
original_page_nr.description: References the original page number (starting with 1) on which the cropping box has been detected.

expires_at.title: Expires At
expires_at.description: The expiration date of the share token. Tokens expire on the given day at 00:00:00 UTC

expires_at.title: Expires At
expires_at.description: The expiration date of the share token. Tokens expire on the given day at 00:00:00 UTC

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: An identifier for the created sharing token.

last_used_at.title: Last Used At
last_used_at.description: When this sharing token has last been used for an API access.

token.title: Token
token.description: The actual sharing token to include into urls or request headers.

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique id of the document.

filename_origin.title: Filename Origin
filename_origin.description: The name of the uploaded file.

num_pages.title: Num Pages
num_pages.description: The number of pages of the document.

language.description: The language of the document or null if it is not known.

process_instance_id.title: Process Instance Id
process_instance_id.description: The workflow's reference id, if this document is processed by a workflow.

process_instance.title: Process Instance
process_instance.description: For documents processed by a workflow, detailed processing information can be returned.

retrieved.title: Retrieved
retrieved.description: Once a document's OCR or extraction results have been retrieved through the API, this flag is set to `True`.

data.title: Data
data.description: The jpg image of one page encoded as base64.

date.title: Date
date.description: Partial ISO-8601 datetime format: e.g. "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY-MM-DD" or "YYYY-MM-DDThhZ" or "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ", with an accuracy depending on the aggregation frequency.

processed_credits.title: Processed Credits
processed_credits.description: Total credit cost for all successful workflow instances within the time window.

num_documents.title: Num Documents
num_documents.description: Total number of processed documents for all successful workflow instances within the time window.

num_pages.title: Num Pages
num_pages.description: Total number of processed pages for all successful workflow instances within the time window.

average_time_per_page.title: Average Time Per Page
average_time_per_page.description: Average processing time (submit until finish) per page.

discount_percentage.title: Discount Percentage
discount_percentage.description: The percentage is only returned if it is written on the document, i.e. it is not calculated.

line_items.title: Line Items
line_items.description: A list of line items, where each line item is a list of references to bounding boxes.

bboxes.title: Bboxes
bboxes.description: A list of boxes that each surrounds one of the detected words.

rotation_angle.title: Rotation Angle
rotation_angle.description: If the page's rotation was corrected, this variable contains the degrees of rotation around the page center (potentially after cropping).

cropping_box.title: Cropping Box
cropping_box.description: If the page was cropped, the coordinates represent the cropped part on the original page-image.

fulltext.title: Fulltext
fulltext.description: All detected text on the page in a multiline string.
fulltext.example: The fulltext of your document"as multiline string.

line_items.title: Line Items
line_items.description: A list of line items, where each line item is a list of references to bounding boxes.

bboxes.title: Bboxes
bboxes.description: A list of boxes that each surrounds one of the detected words.

line_items.title: Line Items
line_items.description: A list of line items, where each line item is a list of references to bounding boxes.

bboxes.title: Bboxes
bboxes.description: A list of boxes that each surrounds one of the detected words.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of this process instance.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of this process instance.

process_definition_key.title: Process Definition Key
process_definition_key.description: This process is an instance of the definition specified by this key.

status.description: The status of this process instance.

activity_instances.title: Activity Instances
activity_instances.description: The list of activity instances that have been executed in this process so far.

ResellerCreatableRole.title: ResellerCreatableRole
ResellerCreatableRole.description:
The roles that users of this API can create.

    - Manager: Users with this role can manage user accounts, manage workflows and process documents.
    - User: A restricted API user, that can only process documents with pre-existing workflows.

profile_picture.title: Profile Picture
profile_picture.description: This URL retrieves the user profile picture if it is found.

Role.title: Role
Role.description:
The roles that users of this API can have.

    N.B. This enum includes all roles. The enum CreatableRole creates all roles that a realm or tenant admin may create.
    Especially, resellers are excluded from this list because we do not want customers to be able to create a new
    reseller. Make sure to keep the remaining roles in these lists in sync.

    N.B. Ensure that test cases are adopted where applicable.

expires_in.title: Expires In
expires_in.description: The expiration time of the access token in seconds.

refresh_expires_in.title: Refresh Expires In
refresh_expires_in.description: The expiration time of the refresh token in seconds.

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: A token that can be used to obtain a new access token.

token_type.title: Token Type
token_type.description: The method how the issued access token can be used.

nr_pages.title: Nr Pages
nr_pages.description: Sum of pages in all documents.

nr_pages.title: Nr Pages
nr_pages.description: Sum of pages in all documents.

nr_pages.title: Nr Pages
nr_pages.description: Sum of pages in all documents.

nr_pages.title: Nr Pages
nr_pages.description: Sum of pages in all documents.

customer.title: Customer
customer.description: The customer for which the usage is returned, or `all` if usage is returned for all customers.

user.title: User
user.description: The user for which the usage is returned, or `all` if usage is returned for all users.

by_process_definition.description: Usage aggregated by process definition. Only for documents processed with the workflow system.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: Meta information for the returned usages.

WorkflowAccessLevel.title: WorkflowAccessLevel
WorkflowAccessLevel.description:
- `read`: this workflow can be seen by the current user.
    - `process`: this workflow can be used for processing by the current user.
    - `manage`: this workflow can be managed  (i.e. altered) the current user.

WorkflowVisibility.title: WorkflowVisibility
WorkflowVisibility.description:
- `public`: this workflow is available to any natif.ai user.
    - `custom`: this workflow is customized and not publicly accessible.

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country.

field.title: Field
field.description: The name of the field. For hierarchical structures use dots, e.g. 'customer.name'.

correct_value.title: Correct Value
correct_value.description: If you know what the correct value for the field would have been, provide it here. Leave empty if unsure.

description.title: Description
description.description: A free-text field that can be used for describing the error. It will be displayed to annotators to help them find the error more quickly.

incorrect_fields.title: Incorrect Fields
incorrect_fields.description: If you know which errors were made, provide them here as a list.

use_technical_interface.title: Use Technical Interface
use_technical_interface.description:
Determines which web interface will be displayed after login at https://platform.natif.ai for all users within this customer.
- `false`: the new Api-Hub interface
- `true`: the previous, more technical interface

organizational_info.title: Organizational Info
organizational_info.description: Meta information about the customers organization.

value.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country.

discount_percentage.title: Discount Percentage
discount_percentage.description: The percentage is only returned if it is written on the document, i.e. it is not calculated.

data_access__schemas__constants__base_ex.title: PaymentMethod
data_access__schemas__constants__base_ex.description:
Supported payment methods.

    Note: `multiple_options` is deprecated.

value.description: Standardized name of payment method category.

raw_value.title: Raw Value
raw_value.description: Value before correction. Get the raw value from `bbox_refs` instead.

discount_percentage.title: Discount Percentage
discount_percentage.description: The percentage is only returned if it is written on the document, i.e. it is not calculated.

data_access__schemas__constants__iso__La.title: Language
data_access__schemas__constants__iso__La.description: ISO 639-1 two-letter lower-case representation of names of languages.

scopes.capturing_write: Allows write access for capturing requests and results.
scopes.capturing_read: Allows read access for capturing requests and obtaining results.
scopes.user_management: Allows read-write access to user management functionality.
scopes.client_management: Allows read-write access to client management functionality.

tags.name: OAuth
tags.description: This API implements the [OAuth 2.0](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749) specification. Use it to authenticate and authorize your usage of the other endpoints.

tags.name: Document Capturing
tags.description:
This API provides all endpoints required for capturing documents.
The capturing process can be divided into three steps:
1. [Upload](#operation/upload_document_documents__post) a document for capturing.
Processing options can be passed as query parameters.
2. Poll the document using [this](#operation/get_document_documents__document_id__get) endpoint until
`processing_status` turns into `success`.
3. Use the respective endpoints for getting the
[extraction](#operation/get_extractions_documents__document_id__extractions_get) or
[ocr](#operation/get_ocr_documents__document_id__ocr_get) results or the
[processed images](#operation/get_processed_pages_documents__document_id__processed_get).

tags.name: User Management
tags.description:
If you are a reseller, use the
[Create customer](#operation/create_customer_user_management_customer_post) endpoint to create a new customer in
the system. Next [create](#operation/create_user_user_management_user_post) one or more users for the customer.
The default choice is to create an initial user with role `manager`, that has the permissions to invite and add other
users.

If you are a customer with a management account, you can
[create yourself additional user accounts](#operation/create_user_user_management_user_post).

tags.name: Reseller User Management
tags.description: This API provides endpoints for managing customers as a reseller.

tags.name: Usage Statistics
tags.description:
This API provides endpoints for viewing usage statistics.
Following is a list of allowed actions that depend on your user's role.
* Reseller:
    * View total usage of the reseller realm
    * View usage of a specific customer
* Manager:
    * View total usage of the customer account
    * View usage of a specific user
* User:
    * View own usage
